title-group.article-title: A-Priori Analysis and the Finite Element Method for a Class of Degenerate Elliptic Equations

abstract.p: Consider the degenerate elliptic operator $L_\delta : = - \partial _x^2 - {{\delta ^2 } \over {x^2 }}\partial _y^2 $ on Ω := (0,1) × (0,l), for δ > 0,l > 0. We prove well-posedness and regularity results for the degenerate elliptic equation $L_{\delta u} = f\,in\,\Omega ,\,u|_{\partial \Omega } = 0$ in using weighted Sobolev spaces $K_a^m $ . In particular, by a proper choice of the parameters in the weighted Sobolev spaces $K_a^m $ , we establish the existence and uniqueness of the solution. In addition, we show that there is no loss of $K_a^m $ - regularity for the solution of the equation. We then provide an explicit construction of a sequence of finite dimensional subspaces $V_n $ for the finite element method, such that the optimal convergence rate is attained for the finite element solution $u_n \,\varepsilon \,V_n ,$ , $i.e.,\,\left\| {u - u_n } \right\|_{H^1 \left( \Omega \right)\,} \le \,C\dim (V_n )^{ - {m \over 2}} \left\| f \right\|_{H^{m - 1} (\Omega )} $ with C independent of ƒ and n.
